title: Agent
description: An Agent is a declarative way of configuring a given instance of q chat.

$schema.description: The schema to use for validating the agent

description.description: This field is not model facing and is mostly here for users to discern between agents

prompt.description:
The intention for this field is to provide high level context to the
agent. This should be seen as the same category of context as a system prompt.

mcpServers.description: Configuration for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers

command.description: The command string used to initialize the mcp server

args.description: A list of arguments to be used to run the command with

env.description: A list of environment variables to run the command with

timeout.description: Timeout for each mcp request in ms

disabled.description: A boolean flag to denote whether or not to load this mcp server

tools.description:
List of tools the agent can see. Use \"@{MCP_SERVER_NAME}/tool_name\" to specify tools from
mcp servers. To include all tools from a server, use \"@{MCP_SERVER_NAME}\"

toolAliases.description: Tool aliases for remapping tool names

additionalProperties.description: The name to change to. For tools in mcp servers, you would need to exclude their server prefix

propertyNames.description: Subject of the tool name change. For tools in mcp servers, you would need to prefix them with their server names

allowedTools.description: List of tools the agent is explicitly allowed to use

resources.description: Files to include in the agent's context

hooks.description: Commands to run when a chat session is created

command.description: The command to run when the hook is triggered

toolsSettings.description:
Settings for specific tools. These are mostly for native tools. The actual schema differs by
tools and is documented in detail in our documentation

additionalProperties.description: Settings for tools. Refer to our documentations to see how to configure them

propertyNames.description: The name of the tool to be configured

useLegacyMcpJson.description:
Whether or not to include the legacy ~/.aws/amazonq/mcp.json in the agent
You can reference tools brought in by these servers as just as you would with the servers
you configure in the mcpServers field in this config
